de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.factory

Class BufferedImageGraphicsFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.gnwi.mfsim.model.graphics.factory.BufferedImageGraphicsFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGraphicsFactory

    public class BufferedImageGraphicsFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGraphicsFactory
    Class for pixel based graphics factory.
    Author:
    Achim Zielesny

    • Constructor Detail

      • BufferedImageGraphicsFactory

        public BufferedImageGraphicsFactory(int aWidth,
                                    int aHeight,
                                    boolean anIsIntermediateImageCreation)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        aWidth - The width of the main image in pixel
        aHeight - The height of the main image in pixel
        anIsIntermediateImageCreation - True: Intermediate images are created, false: Attenuation image is returned as intermediate image

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the main image

        public void cleanUp()
        Clean up

      • attenuateToBackgroundColor

        public void attenuateToBackgroundColor(double anAttenuation)
        Attenuates the color of the the main image by an attenuation towards the background color. NOTE: If anAttenuation is very small there may be graphical effects due to round-off errors.
        Specified by:
        attenuateToBackgroundColor in interface IGraphicsFactory
        Parameters:
        anAttenuation - Attenuation: 1.0 or bigger means background color, 0.0 or smaller means remain unchanged.

      • drawOpaque

        public void drawOpaque(java.lang.Object aGraphicsObject,
                       int anUpperLeftX,
                       int anUpperLeftY,
                       int aWidthAndHeight)
        Draws an opaque partial image at the specified x-, y-coordinate to the main image. NOTE: try-catch is necessary due to rare unsolved ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in this method caused by SimulationBoxViewSingleMoveStepSlice
        Specified by:
        drawOpaque in interface IGraphicsFactory
        Parameters:
        aGraphicsObject - Opaque buffered image
        anUpperLeftX - The x coordinate of the upper left position
        anUpperLeftY - The y coordinate of the upper left position
        aWidthAndHeight - The width and height of the image to draw on the main image (width = height)

      • drawTransparent

        public void drawTransparent(java.lang.Object aGraphicsObject,
                            int anUpperLeftX,
                            int anUpperLeftY,
                            int aWidthAndHeight)
        Draws a transparent partial image at the specified x-, y-coordinate to the main image. NOTE: try-catch is necessary due to rare unsolved ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException in this method caused by SimulationBoxViewSingleMoveStepSlice
        Specified by:
        drawTransparent in interface IGraphicsFactory
        Parameters:
        aGraphicsObject - Transparent buffered image
        anUpperLeftX - The x coordinate of the upper left position
        anUpperLeftY - The y coordinate of the upper left position
        aWidthAndHeight - The width and height of the image to draw on the main image (width = height)
